creator: Franklin, John (Sir), 1786-1847. (author)
description: Franklin, John (Sir): 1786-1847. Arctic explorer. // Illustrations are hand coloured. Also published, 2nd edition, London: J. Murray, 1824 (2 vols.: xix, 370p.; iv, 399p.); 3rd edition, London: J. Murray, 1824 (2 vols.); London: J. Murray, [1828] (xv, 783, [1]p.); London: J.M. Dent and New York: E.P. Dutton & Co., [1910] and [1924] (x, 434p.); New York: Greenwood Press, [1969] (xvi, 768p.); with new introduction by Louis Melzack, Edmonton: M.G. Hurtig and Rutland, Vt., 1970 (xix, 768p.); with new introduction by James P. Delgado, and the 1908 introduction by Captain Scott, Vancouver: Douglas & McIntyre, 2000 (291p.); and as Narrative of a journey to the shores of the Polar Sea in the years 1819, 20, 21 & 22: With an appendix containing geognostical observations, and remarks on the Aurora Borealis , Philadelphia: H.C. Carey & I. Lea, A. Small, Edward Parker, M'Carty & Davis, B. & T. Kite, Thomas Desilver, and E. Littell, 1824 (xi, 482p.). Two of Franklin's journeys, as well as Richardson's account, are in Journey to the shores of the Polar Sea, in 1819-20-21-22: With a brief account of the second journey in 1825-26-27 , London: John Murray, 1829 (4 vols.). Some members of the party wintered at Cumberland House in 1819-1820. In chapters 2-5 there is a description of the people and events in the Saskatchewan country.
format: [2], 1 leaf, [vii]-xvi, 768 p., illus., ports., fold. maps.; 27 cm.
subject: Explorers, Surveyors and Travellers--Overland Journeys to the Arctic

title: Narrative of a journey to the shores of the polar sea in the years 1819, 20, 21, and 22: With an appendix on various subjects relating to science and natural history
